### hasConstantOrUndefValue() {#a75454a3088d70df13b65e7b844e4b7a3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool PHINode::hasConstantOrUndefValue () const">
Whether the specified PHI node always merges together the same value, assuming undefs are equal to a unique non-undef value.

hasConstantOrUndefValue - Whether the specified PHI node always merges together the same value, assuming that undefs result in the same value as non-undefs.

Unlike <a href="#ace87755a2044122196774c1cb0368fde">hasConstantValue</a>, this does not return a value because the unique non-undef incoming value need not dominate the PHI node.

If the PHI node is complete which means all of its parent&#39;s predecessors have incoming value in this PHI, return true, otherwise return false.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l02805">2805</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>.

### removeIncomingValue() {#a6f01dbe965b38186b1a78378689d4105}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>Value &#42; PHINode::removeIncomingValue (unsigned Idx, bool DeletePHIIfEmpty=<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/basicaliasanalysis-cpp/#af6d5cafbdfc5313e65d990120021a3ec">true</a>)</>}>
Remove an incoming value.

This is useful if a predecessor basic block is deleted. The value removed is returned.

If the last incoming value for a PHI node is removed (and DeletePHIIfEmpty is true), the PHI node is destroyed and any uses of it are replaced with dummy values. The only time there should be zero incoming values to a PHI node is when the block is dead, so this strategy is sound.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h/#l02752">2752</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/instructions-h">Instructions.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp/#l00137">137</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/ir/instructions-cpp">Instructions.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
